title: Can we verify anything in the game?
body:
1. RIOT force us to BELIEVE that Player Selecting System work fine even we can not veryfy it.
2. RIOT force us to BELIEVE that MMR exist even we can not see it.
3. RIOT force us to BELIEVE that C score specific player and S score of our champion means exactly the same and it is relevant to same MMR and if "C player" and "S player" are in the same team - everything is fine.

We can not veryfy but we have to believe. Is the LOL is some kind of new religion?

Shiwah. It took me over a  week to get Neo to stop trying to Argue with me that Elo systems cant be used for other games.

> ELO system was "invented" for 1vs1 chess games and is has nothing to do with RIOT system (it can not have).

And

> I know how "systems" works... I do not know how LOL MMR system work (this specific system). 
general assumption of the (traditional) MMR system is to evaluate specific player with his game 1vs1 and it based on ELO that comes from chess system. System ELO does exist also in case of team games but there whole team can be assesed as a whole element not as a single players - which is mean that in the case of randomly slected players - it make no sense at all.

Then when I finally got him to watching a video of some one making and testing a Team Elo system. One that clearly states that for it to function it needs to track each players adjustment separately. So that not every player will have the same MMR stake in a game. He ignored it, completely refused to address why that was necessary. Then went and used the part of the video showing the most common misconception people have for how it works that the author went and mathematically proved DOES NOT WORK. And acted like that's what riot has to be using.

So for this post.

How do you Verify if a system uses mmr? Look at the top and bottom of the ranked ladder. Look at the start point for a new account.  Look for who sinks and who climbs.

There's a few types of rating and ranking systems. Some use EXP = # of games played.  Some are just gloried leaderboards that track # of total wins or kills. 

It is by no means difficult to judge accurate what type of matchmaker/rating/ranking system is used if you know what's out there. Its pretty easy to check. You have expectations for the system. Does the system work to meet those expectations. You Look at the game as a whole not just your personal interaction.


How do you verify that skill matters in a game? Look at yourself. When you first started vs how good you are now. Would 5 starter you ever beat a team of 5 current you if both sides are playing to win?

Why does Stats not matter to mmr compaired to win rates?  Because mismatched games are hard to judge. In Chess, the Fools mate. White loses in 2 moves.  Almost any one can do this, the requirement is whites just that bad. Its the quickest possible way to win in chess. There's no way to judge black players skill because whites just god awful.

In league. Its very easy to play for stats. Ward a lot. CS a lot. Use ability's every time they are off CD that you can add to your damage count. Use teammates as meatsheilds and guard your KDA.  Hilariously a lot of folks who only play for stats have awful win rates because they are unwilling to give up stats to actually win a match. Tank a skillshot and die so your carry can live.  Don't spam your ability's constantly, they are not a threat if they are on CD. 

Any how. I went over all of this time and time again with neo to the point he just reports me to mods for harassment.
So my advice is follow the Universal rules.
